intro: Diplusodon lythroides var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf diplusodon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
